content:
Bryan Cantrill and Steve Tuck, the co-founders of Oxide, are on the pod live (to tape) from the stage at OxCon. Jerod and I were invited to Oxide's annual internal conference to meet the people and to hear the stories of what makes Oxide a truly special place to work right now. The best part was this on-stage discussion with Bryan and Steve. Enjoy! :link: https://changelog.am/110

Ch Start Title Runs

02 00:28 Sponsor: CodeRabbit 01:07
03 01:35 Changelog at Oxide 01:34
04 03:08 Exceptional team 03:49
05 06:57 The rigorous process 04:59
06 11:56 Being self-aware 01:24
07 13:21 Bias-free process 01:58
08 15:19 Great materials, but not for this role 02:15
09 17:34 Growth means hiring 02:25
10 19:59 No "youngsters"? 04:28
11 24:27 Trust. 02:10
12 26:36 Strength of culture 05:05
13 31:42 Materials for Sales 04:19
14 36:01 How can this scale? 01:25
15 37:26 Uniform compensation for life? 05:24
16 42:50 Inspired by Oxide 04:27
17 47:17 We landed on a good process 07:16
18 54:33 This is a scale moment 08:22
19 1:02:55 The 4 big risks 03:46
20 1:06:41 Glimpse over the horizon 01:17
21 1:07:59 Closing thoughts and stuff 02:48

We accidentally shipped the wrong mp3 on this episode! It's been replaced/purged so redownloading in your podcast app should get you the right one now...
I wonder if some sort of comparison between the audio and the transcript could be automated to detect this? Unless it's the sort of freak accident that isn't worth the test effort...
Transcripts come later. And yeah this happens maybe once a year
Loved having you all out to Oxide and loved this episode. You all are great!
